titles.title: Lumbee Recognition Act
Lumbee Recognition Act
A bill to provide for the acknowledgment of the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 109-610.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator McCain without amendment. With written report No. 109-334.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 606.

bill.summary: 9/13/2006--Reported to Senate without amendment. Lumbee Recognition Act - Amends federal law relating to the Lumbee Indians of North Carolina to extend federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina. Authorizes appropriations.
